page.title: 1892 Years Living in Harpenden
page.content:
Mr Chalkley was born in a cottage next door to the shoe repair shop in Grove Road. He is 92 years old and has lived in Harpenden all his life.
His father was a gardener on an estate, now Aldwickbury school and his mother plaited straw at home.
At ten years of age he delivered papers to Mackerye End. He started work at 16 as an apprentice at Kingston House Mowers and worked there for 52 years. He fought for the mounted cavalry in the lst World War.
Mr Chalkley has seen many changes in Harpenden. The Council dammed off the River Lea to make a swimming pool and it was vandalised. Although Harpenden has been through many changes he does not think Harpenden is spoilt.
